page.title: 09The school
page.content: An Interview with Miss Smith Continued. In 1939 many children were evacuated from the cities to East Winch and they came to the village school.There was no piped water at this time and if anyone wanted a drink he had to get one from a bucket. The school was lit with oil lamps until 1947 when electricity was brought to the village. the children sat six to a desk and sat on benches or forms. During Miss Smith's early days as headteacher there were between thirty and forty children at the school. There was no telephone, no school meals or milk . Many of the children lived a long way from school. If they lived more than three miles away they would be provided with transport.
